title: Bold geometric sans in Intersection magazine UK
content:
Hi,  
Having trouble identifying this typeface.  
Seeking Type Gurus for knowledge : )

gus

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [what typeface 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/typophile.com/files/what%20typeface%201.jpg) | 62.64 KB |
| [what typeface 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/typophile.com/files/what%20typeface%202.jpg) | 64.58 KB |

 [‹ Collyer Bristow logo id](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46460 "Go to previous forum topic") [Modern, squarish font. Can anyone help me with this font's name? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46455 "Go to next forum topic")
author: guswang

comments.content: Don’t think I’ve seen that one. I wonder if it has the same woody origins as [Phosphate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/red_rooster/phosphate_solid/).

Thanks Stephen for your references.

I wonder if the magazine tweaked the typeface or maybe it’s their in-house original.  
Notice the ’G’ is all rounded or a perfect circle until it hits the chin.

gus
There is an alternate ’G” in Proxima Nova that is close. Click on the ’G’ in the character set.
Could it be possible that they clipped off odd bits of [Dynamoe](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=dynamoe&q=Go)?
Err, are you in the right thread, Yvesie?
Hehe, that’s what I thought. But then I thought I’d better just say nothing. ;)
I reckon Yves was talking about [Dynamo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161736/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/dynamo/).

Whoops! One ’e’ too many. BTW I _always_ add ’FF’ to FontFont names. :^P

\> _Err, are you in the right thread, Yvesie?_

I’d have to be on drugs _really_ badly before I confused those two, now, wouldn’t I? :^D

\> _Hehe, that’s what I thought. But then I thought I’d better just say nothing._ ;)

See, that’s the difference — I’ve never been scared to ridicule myself. ;^)
Indeed this font was based on Dynamo. We don’t use it anymore but all our headline fonts are custom-made, albeit in a very amateurish way.. I’d be curious to know what typographer think about them...
